line.en: 'We tried to find another way while you weren't\nhere, but... it'll be hard to do preparations\nnow.'
Ageha searched for other ways to launch besides a\nwinch or rubber cord, but she couldn't find\nsomething we could do in time.
'...Even though the signs have come.'
'I'll try to look some more.'
'Okay. I'm counting on you.'
As I was saying that, I pulled out my phone to\ncheck for messages.
'No New Messages' was displayed on the screen.
Ever since then, I hadn't heard from Kotori.
Had she already discussed it with her father?
Since I hadn't heard anything, it probably meant\nnothing had been decided but...
I decided to write a message to Kotori.
I saw a sign just now. The Morning Glory is\ncoming tomorrow morning.
She'll definitely come back.
Knowing that, I pressed 'Send'.
'Dinner's here!'
Asa and Yoru came back, each holding a big\nshopping bag.
'Oh, hey guys.'
'There weren't many rice balls, so we got\nsandwiches instead.'
'And Asa bought a whole bunch of snacks.'
'Thanks.'
We are going to stay here tonight.
I had the two of them go stock up for our siege.
'How are things going here?'
'Things are probably going to be a bit difficult\nfrom here on out.'
'Which means...'
'The only way left is using the rubber cord.'
Yoru looked devastated.
'What happened with Kotori?'
Ageha looked at me.
I shook my head to reply.
'I haven't heard anything yet.'
'And the Morning Glory will be coming so soon...'
'Why not try asking Hibari? She could bring\nKotori here just for the Morning Glory.'
'I'm going to wait a bit longer. If I don't hear\nback, I'll do that.'
If that sign was correct, the real thing was\ncoming tomorrow morning.
Even then, it would only be around for two, maybe\nthree hours.
'Of course, that's only if we can fly the glider.\nWithout it, we can't take off so it doesn't mean\nanything.'
'Yeah...'
'Hey guys? Let's eat!'
Asa seemed to try to perk us up just as we were\ngetting down.
'Yeah.'
'Now that you mention it, I am getting hungry.'
Without realizing it, our normal meal time had\nlong since passed.
Everyone started to take whatever they wanted out\nof the shopping bags.
While waiting for her instant noodles, Ageha\nsearched for a picture of the rubber towing cable\nfound earlier in the day.
A huge crowd of people pulled on the cord and the\nglider rose only a few scant meters.
That was a simple, light glider.
Our two-seater would never be able to get in the\nair by this method.
Everyone stared at the screen, half having given\nup.
'Hey, what's that?'
'It's a rubber towing cable... WHOA!?'
All of a sudden, there was Amane, peaking over\nAgeha's shoulder to see the computer screen.
'Amane!!? When did you get here?'
Placing her helmet on the desk, she answered\nwhile looking at the screen.
'Just a little while ago. I'm a little hurt that\nnobody noticed when I came in.'
We had been staring at the screen so hard we\ndidn't even notice she'd arrived.
'Rubber towing cable... Huh, I didn't know you\ncould do it that way too.'
She seemed genuinely interested. I guess there\nare things even she doesn't know.
She began looking at all the resources Ageha had\nbrought up.
'Hmm, I see... Aha.'
'This is interesting. But it won't make our\nglider fly.'
My heart sunk as soon as the words came out of\nher mouth.
If Amane Mochizuki says it's impossible, it's\nimpossible.
'Hmm? What's wrong? Why do you look so sad?'
'Well, the truth is...'
I told Amane about the broken winch.
'...Is that right...'
'So that's why I was searching for another\nmethod.'
Amane began looking at the resources again.
This time she was serious.
'...I guess it's nearly impossible?'
'It is... Hmm...'
Amane grunted at the screen. I guess it is\nimpossible.
'...By the way, what happened to Kotori?'
She spoke as if she had just remembered about\nher.
A shocked look came across my face.
That's right. With everything that had happened I\nforgot to tell Amane about Kotori.
'She's supposed to leave the hospital today,\nright...?'
Ageha was looking worried.
'Oh, yeah. She didn't seem to have any major\ninjuries. ...She seems good.'
'Really? That's good.'
'But after that...'
I explained to her what happened after Kotori\nleft the hospital.
'So that's what happened...'
'And you haven't heard anything from her yet?'
'Right. Nothing yet.'
Amane began looking worried again.
'You saw the signs earlier, right? That's why I\ncame here.'
'I thought for sure that Kotori would be flying.'
'But... So, she won't be able to fly...'
'We've been searching for a way to at least show\nher, even if she isn't able to fly...'
We were pretty much ready to give up.
'This rubber cord seems to be the only way\nleft...'
'What if we attach a jump ramp to the runway?'
Asa suddenly spoke up.
Everyone then turned their attention to her.
'Then while everyone is pulling, the glider is\nlike this to the jump ramp...'
She began to explain with shaking hands.
Basically, there would be a jump ramp on the\nrunway and the glider would be shot up the ramp.
'If it goes well, at the very least it should\nstill fly higher than in this video.'
'Right!'
Amane shook her head.
'There won't be enough acceleration. Even if you\nget it up to five or six meters, it'll lose speed\ntoo quickly.'
'Too much force would have to be sacrificed to\nget it up the ramp to begin with.'
'So it's no good...'
'Even making a jump ramp... If we started now\nwe'd probably barely make it in time. It's pretty\nmuch impossible.'
'Basically, the glider would have to go up at\nleast ten meters after it hit the ramp.'
'If there isn't a strong lift right at the end of\nthe jump ramp, there's really no point at all.'
Everyone was in deep thought.
'If there was only a way to create a lift...'
'That or have it go off the cliff? Maybe that\nwould do something.'
Just as I had about given up, I head a clap of\nexcitement come from Amane.
'Aha! That'd work!'
Everyone looked at her in confusion.
'Right, right! There's no need to have anything\nto fly off of from the runway.'
'But that's dangerous...'
'Even if we were to start to fly like that, if we\ndidn't have a lift at that point, what would\nhappen...?'
The drop would cause acceleration, but if there\nwas no way to rise after that, it'd be completely\npointless.

If the glider was still high enough after it
accelerated, that would be fine. But that'd have
to be from a really high cliff. Basically,
impossible.
However suddenly Amane spoke up.
'Hmm, let's go with it and try it out at least.'
She began nodding her head as if it had already\nbeen decided.
'Let's see, I need paper and something to write\nwith...'
'Here you are!'
Taking paper and a pen from Asa, Amane began to\nwrite furiously.
'The glider itself is about 280kg, plus the two\nof them, which weigh about 100...'
The paper began to fill up with mathematical\nequations and diagrams.
'Paper.'
'Uh, here.'
Asa laid down another sheet for Amane, who hadn't\neven lifted her head.
'That won't be enough.'
Yoru grabbed a bundle of paper and plopped it\ndown in front of Amane.
Without even looking up, Amane took more paper\nand kept on writing.
'She's in a trance... I haven't seen her like\nthis for a while.'
Amane had an intense look of concentration on her\nface.
This was exactly like the first time I met her,\nwhen she was staring at the drawing board.
When she's like this she'll even forget that\nshe's hungry, and she's quite the eater.
'...Hmm, I see, I see. That is a possibility.'
Yoru was nodding along in agreement as she read\nthrough the sheets of paper Amane was producing.
Then...
'It feels like I'm just wasting time. Here, I'll\nhelp too.'
Saying that, she sat down next to Amane and began\nscribbling out equations.
I couldn't believe my eyes.
'Huh? You're going to help!!?'
'...What is going on here?'
'...I don't know, but it's a little scary.'
Unable to follow along with what was going on, we\njust watched in amazement.
*scribble scribble scribble scribble*
The scratching sound of both pens went on and on,\nalmost without a single pause.
Both Amane and Yoru kept on writing without\nsaying a word.
They way they were working, it almost seemed as\nif they were communicating in an entirely\ndifferent language.
We, that is Ageha, Asa, and myself, stayed back\nand had our own conversation.
'From what I heard from Akari, the glider should\nbe in the gym storeroom.'
'There's a sturdy lock on the door. It's not\nsomething you could just hit and break open.'
'...But there isn't any security there.'
'Which means the only problem is the lock.'
'Tobioka-sensei probably isn't watching over\nit... right?'
'That old fart may very well be.'
Without a winch he'd think we can't fly. There's\nno way he's still worrying about us.
With Amane working this hard, perhaps something\nmight happen after all.
Now all that's left is to take back the glider.
'Even if we take care of the lock, how are we\ngoing to move the glider?'
'Hmm... If An-chan could help that'd work.'
'This might be too much, though...'
What we're doing could get us arrested if things\ndon't go perfectly.
Since we were students, the school would probably\nhandle disciplining us. That wouldn't be the case\nfor An-chan.
Everyone was already prepared to be punished by\nthe school.
If there was a way to fly, we'd do it. That's how\nwe all felt.
'We could just move it like we did before.'
There's a bicycle with a wagon attached at the\ngrocer's shop down on Kazami Shopping Street.
It would be difficult, but if we could load the\ndisassembled glider onto the cart, someone could\npedal while others pushed.
We needed a way to do it without the teachers\nnoticing us.
'Breaking the lock will be noisy. That'll\ndefinitely get us noticed.'
'Hmm, there really isn't a quiet way to break the\nlock. We could use a saw... but that might take\ntoo long.'
'What if we just take some wire and wiggle it\naround the lock and...'
'No, no, no. It only works like that in\ncartoons.'
The more we talked about different plans, the\nmore realistic it seemed.
The possibility of flying the Morning Glory.
The glider was taken. Our winch was broken.\nEverything had seemed to be over.
Even so, there is still something missing...
'(I still haven't heard from Kotori...)'
Looking at the clock, I noticed it was just about\nto turn to midnight.
There was still time until it began, but it was\ngetting late.
I looked at my cell phone and continued to grow\nnervous.
'...Kotori is late.'
'We still haven't heard anything...'
'Yeah.'
Did she read my message?
I can't imagine she'd remain quite if she knew\nthat the signs had appeared.
'Geez, even when I first met her I could tell she\nwas a trouble maker.'
'That's because she's the youngest child.'
As I was responding with a laugh,
my phone rang.
It wasn't a message. It was a call!
'Hello?'
'Ah, hello. Aoi? It's Kanako.'
'Kanako?'
'Yeah uh, actually, Hibari just came here now.'
'She says she has something to give to you so,\nI'm sorry but could you come back now?'
'Yeah, I'll be right there.'
I closed my phone and stood up.
'I'll be right back.'
I ran up the hill panting.
Why did Hibari come?
Is Kotori with her?
What did she want to give me?
I was out of breath, but I ran on, fueled by my\nworries.
'*pant* ... *pant* *pant* ...!'
I suddenly heard my cell phone ringing in my\npocket. I had a message.
'*pant* *pant* ... *pant ...?'
I paused for a second and checked my phone.
It was from Kotori.
The message had no title.
I hesitated for a moment and the opened the\nmessage.
I'm sorry I didn't call. But if I talked to you\nnow, I'd probably go crazy.
'Go crazy...?'
I almost dropped my cell phone, my hands were\nshaking so much.
Steadying my phone with both hands, I continued\nto read.
I talked with my father. I decided to go back to\nTokyo.
I am going to take a break for the rest of summer\nvacation.
I really want to stay in Kazegaura, but there is\njust no way I can keep worrying my parents like\nthis.
After reading that, I closed my eyes for a\nmoment.
At the same time I felt both shocked and like I\nknew this was going to happen.
Spending this past year with you guys was really\nfun.
It's one of my dearest memories. I wish I had\nmade a photo album.
I'm sorry that I caused so much trouble for you\nall.
I want you to fly through the Morning Glory\nwithout worrying about me.
That's the only thing I want right now.
So,
Thank you for loving me, Aoi. Even though I'm\ngoing back to Tokyo, I won't forget you.
The message ended there.
'What...'
I held my phone as tightly as I could in my\nshaking hands.
It's plastic casing began to creak.
As soon as I snapped back to reality, I called\nKotori.
'This user is currently not available. Please\nleave a message after the tone...'
'...What is going on?'
'Why aren't you answering, Kotori!!'
I yelled without realizing it.
Feeling overwhelmingly at a loss, I nearly flung\nmy phone down at the ground.
I managed to control myself and instead, called a\ndifferent number.
'Come on... Answer...'
After calling a ridiculous amount of times, maybe\ntwenty or so, someone finally answered the phone.
'Hello...'
'Kotori!'
'Kotori...!'
Hearing Kotori's voice after what felt like ages,\nI felt relieved.
I had called Hibari's home phone number.
Since Kotori answered the phone, it means she's\nstill there.
'I read your mail. What happened?'
'...My mother collapsed.'
'...It's all my fault...She...'
My mind went blank for a moment.
I had only asked her what happened, albeit in a\nstrong tone, but she seemed to understand what I\nwas talking about.
'How is she doing...?'
'*sob* She... She's still bedridden.'
'I... When I said on the phone that I was going\nhome... She was so happy... she cried...'
'I took all the responsibility. I was selfish. I\nwanted to ride the hot air balloon. I caused all\nthis pain to my parents.'
'Because I had that accident... Because it's my\nfault... I caused all these problems for my\nfamily...'
'That's not...'
That's not right.
I almost said that. However, right now those\nwords would not console her.
'I didn't want to do that to my parents again...\nBut I did.'
'I don't want to go home...'
'But if I don't go home... My family would\nentirely fall apart. I can't let that happen...'
'But... You...'
'Could you do that? ...Quit school, go back home,\nand then live like that...'
I was only answered with silence.
After a moment, she sighed.
'...I'm not the same as I was a year ago.'
'Back then I hated everything and would run away\nat the drop of a hat.'
'But now I have so many great memories. Meeting\nyou, Ageha, Asa, Yoru, Amane, and everyone else\nat Flying Fish Manor...'
'I made friends at school and had a wonderful\ntime. I found a boyfriend... and fell in love.\nJust like a normal person.'
'...And I flew!'
'All of that was because I met you, Aoi. I did\nall these things that I had never done before.'
'So, I'm okay with this.'
'But there's still one thing you want to do,\nright? One really big thing.'
'Did you read the message? We saw the signs.'
'It's coming. In only a few hours the Morning\nGlory is coming.'
'That dream is over for me.'
'No it isn't!'
'Yes it is!'
'What are you talking about? You can fly now! You\ncan do it on your own!'
'Seriously? When I can't even take a bath\nmyself?'
'The only reason I could do it was because\neveryone helped me. I can't fly by myself.'
'Kotori...'
I couldn't believe it.
She was throwing away everything we worked for.
All of our good times together - she was acting\nas if they never happened.
Tears welled in my eyes as frustration coursed\nthrough my heart.
'I really loved being with you this past year.\nI'll always treasure the memories...'
'So... It's enough.'
'It's not enough, Kotori...'
'It's not even close to being enough...!'
My sobbing began to come out through my voice.
When did I start crying?
'Aoi... You should fly.'
'You should fly through the Morning Glory.'
'At least I can look up at the sky...'
She laughed a little. I could tell she was trying\nher best to be strong.
Or perhaps, that was the last thing she thought\nshe could wish for...
I noticed she had hung up.
'Hey Aoi. You're late!'
'...What happened? You're as pale as a ghost...'
'I'm fine. Where's Hibari?'
'In Kotori's room.'
Entering Kotori's room, I saw Hibari packing.
Taking one look at me, Hibari seemed to instantly\nknow what was going on.
She quietly closed a cardboard box packed with\nKotori's textbooks.
'It seems like this is everything...'
Hibari spoke in a whisper as she looked at the\nfew small cardboard boxes that contained all of\nKotori's things.
They were mostly filled with clothes and everyday\nitems. The rest had textbooks in them.
Aside from the stuffed animals that had been on\nthe bed, Kotori didn't have much personal stuff.
'She said having lots of stuff was mostly a\nhassle.'
'Yeah...'
Hibari seemed extremely sad.
I completely understood.
Having only a few things made Kotori's own\nexistence seem somewhat small.
Hibari was silent. Tears began to form in her\neyes.
'I just don't know... I just don't know what the\nbest thing to do is.'
'Of course I don't want her to fly the glider.'
'After that accident... After she lost the\nability to use her legs, flying again just\ndoesn't seem like the right thing...'
'When I saw her get off of the glider, I thought\nmy heart had stopped...'
'...But she flew.'
'Yeah. She wasn't scared at all.'
Even I was surprised by that.
If she was nervous about being up in the sky,\nKotori didn't show it at all.
'I'm still thankful to you guys. I'm really glad\nshe came to Kazegaura.'
'...Kotori was happy again.'
'And... if Kotori wants to do the same things as\nyou all, I want to encourage her.'
'I really think my father feels the same way...'
Saying that, she closed her eyes.
It almost seemed as if she was praying that what\nshe said was the truth.
'The problem is if she stays here, our family's\nissue will only get worse.'
'I heard your mother isn't doing well...?'
'It was only an anemia attack. She's never really\nbeen very healthy.'
'When I called home, she was the first to know\nabout Kotori's accident.'
'My father was at work and wasn't answering his\nphone...'
'He stayed at the hospital one night and I heard\nshe had gotten a little better...'
Considering Kotori's condition, her mother\nalready had to worry more about her than most\nmothers would.
So to hear about the accident, and that it was a\nglider accident, must have been a huge shock.
'Isn't there any way that Kotori could stay?\nSomething other than having her quit school?'
I was getting agitated and my tone was become\nless kind.
However, Hibari only shook her head at me.
'All my parents want right now is to have Kotori\nlive with them.'
'I don't know what will happen later, but for the\ntime being...'
'But she has things she wants to do!'
'Not just this year, but her entire future! What\nis going to happen to her...'
Saying this to Hibari wouldn't change anything.
But I still couldn't help saying it.
An awful silence surrounded us.
Suddenly, the little door within the door opened\nup, and in came a duck.
'Quack?'
Hat entered the room and waddled over to Hibari's\nfeet.
'Hey, Hat.'
Hibari kneeled down and patted Hat's back.
'Quaack!'
'Kotori hasn't come back so he's been searching\nthe dorm for her.'
Hat always does that on days Kotori is late\ncoming home.
'Really...'
'Oh yeah. Kotori asked me to tell you to take\ncare of him.'
'You don't have to worry about him. Sure, he'd be\nlonely, but if you left him alone he'd find food\njust fine.'
'...Hat sure is a strong duck.'
'Quack, quack!'
Hat seemed to enjoy Hibari's petting him.
'What's going to happen to Kotori now?'
'...I'll watch after her tonight.. My father's\ngoing to come for her tomorrow morning.'
'He's going to take care of all of Kotori's\nwithdrawal paperwork. She won't be coming\nhere...'
'Can I see her one more time before she goes?'
'Please, Hibari. Please let me see her.'
Hibari stopped petting Hat. Standing up, she\npulled something out of her bag.
'Here. This is for you.'
She handed me Isuka's navigation diary.
'She said she didn't have any reason to hold onto\nthis any longer.'
'Huh? Oh... Yeah.'
'And this too...'
With a strange look on her face, Hibari handed me\nthe thing she was talking about.
'...What is this?'
'I don't know. She just told me to give it to\nyou.'
It was a paper airplane.
It was a completely normal paper airplane.
I quickly unfolded it, but there was nothing\nwritten on the paper.
'We're going to come back later for her luggage,\nso can we leave it here until then?'
'...Okay.'
With my head hung low, Hibari looked at me with a\nbit of worry in her eye.
'...I'm sure she'll get in touch with you when\nshe's back in Tokyo.'
'Until then, could you just leave it at that,\nplease...'
Saying that in an apologetic tone, Hibari left.
For a moment, I couldn't move from where I stood.
A sudden exhaustion came over me. I did not have\nthe energy to combat it.
I threw myself onto the bed. My eyes glanced over\nat the flight diary I had received earlier.
She said she didn't have any reason to hold onto\nthis any longer.
This notebook was pretty much Kotori's starting\npoint.
After finding it in this room, she then\ndiscovered the glider and flew herself.
Returning it meant Kotori was saying she had made\nup her mind.
Rather, she was throwing it all away, all of her\nfeelings for the sky.
I searched through every page of the notebook to\nsee if she had left a message somewhere.
I couldn't find anything anywhere.
The notebook was exactly as it was before.
I looked at the last page, the 'Things I want to\ndo' list.
Even looking now, there were some ridiculous\nthings written.
One was 'Skip school'. It seems like she had done\nthat one yesterday by accident.
Only the top item, 'Fly through the passage of\nclouds' was left unchecked.
...Even though that could happen tonight.
'...Frustrating, isn't it?'
Looking up to see who spoke, I saw Kanako in the\ndoorway. Just as she had said, I was completely\nfrustrated.
She had probably heard me and Hibari talking.
Kanako came into the room and sat down next to\nme.
'Quack.'
She picked up Hat and put him on her lap.
'...Years back, my cousin had a parakeet.'
'? Is that so...'
'It was adorable. I loved that bird so much that\nI went to my cousin's as much as I could.'
'Parakeets are pretty smart and get attached to\ntheir owners, which is why they like to sit on\nfingers or shoulders. Did you know that?'
I wasn't sure why Kanako was talking about\nparakeets, but I just quietly listened.
'So one day, my cousin bought another one.\nApparently parakeets can get lonely.'
'So I went over as quickly as I could. Ah, I was\nso excited at that moment. I was just a little\ngirl, you know?'
'But, I saw something. I saw the bird's feathers\ngetting cut.'
'Cutting the feathers...?'
'Right.'
Kanako grabbed some of Hat's feathers and flicked\nthem around.
'If you have a pet parakeet, you cut the\nfeathers. Just a little bit off of the tips.\nAlthough it seems not all owners do that.'
'Why in the world would you...'
'I thought the same thing. I couldn't believe it!\nI thought it was terrible.'
'I felt so bad for the parakeet. So I never went\nto my cousin's house again.'
'That is pretty terrible...'
'That's what I thought. But.'
'Years later, when I was a little older, I found\nout there is a reason for doing that.'
'Really? What's that?'
'If you don't, when they're let loose to fly\naround the room, they might fly too strong and\nrun into the walls or ceiling.'
'They'll end up breaking things or, at worst,\nhurting themselves. They could also fly out of a\nwindow.'
'You know how you often see those fliers for a\nmissing parakeet?'
I hadn't seen any recently, but just like I had\nseen them for missing dogs, I had seen a few for\nparakeets as well.
'If their feathers are cut just a little, the\nparakeet can still fly, and if they live with\npeople, it makes it easier on everyone.'
'It's not so they can't fly. It's so that their\nfeathers match the world that they live in.'
'I see...'
I had no idea that was a part of keeping a\nparakeet.
Cutting the feathers sounded awful, but I guess\nit's a bit like keeping a collar on a dog.
'Even now I think about it. About which way would\nbe better...'
'...For the parakeet, right. There are probably\nsome that are happier that way and some that\naren't.'
'To be taken care of by their owner, to always\nhave food, to be away from predators, to always\nhave a safe place to sleep.'
'I suppose that could be happiness, but...'
'But you don't know. You can't ask the parakeet\nhow it feels.'
'...Right.'
As she commented to Hat how he couldn't fly to\nbegin with, she placed him on the floor and stood\nup.
'It would be nice if you could ask the parakeet\nhow it felt.'
She left the room looking frustrated.
'The parakeet's feelings...'
I can at least look up at the sky...
Is that really what Kotori felt?
Even if it was, was that all that she felt?
I don't know.
At any rate, it seems that Kotori had already\ndecided her future.
'Whew...'
'Thanks, Amane.'
'Eh? ...I'm not really that tired, you know.'
'Yoru.'
'Yeah?'
'Do you think you can handle things here? I'm\ngoing to go outside to look.'
'Sure, go ahead.'
'...Didn't really do much, huh.'
'...They sure are late.'
'Yeah... But, I'm not worried. They said they'd\nbe back.'
'Yeah...'
'Ah!! My sugar level!! Asa, chocolate!!'
'Okay, okay. Here you are!'
'Thanks... *chew* *chew* ...She sure is great,\nisn't she?'
'Amane?'
'She's the first person I've met who's smarter\nthan me. It really seems like she is a genius.'
'So do you think it'll fly?'
'Probably. If she can find the perfect place for\nus, that is.'
'Of course, we still don't have all the support\nwe need. Okay... Break's over! Time to get back\nto work.'
Without quite realizing it, I had returned to the\nsecret base where everyone was waiting.
Ageha ran up to me as soon as I came in.
'It looks like we're going to be able to do it,\nAoi!! How about Kotori?'
Saying nothing, I handed over Isuka's navigation\ndiary.
'What... is this...?'
'...She said she didn't have any reason to hold\nonto this any longer.'
'Which means...'
'She's decided to quit school in the middle of\nsummer vacation.'
'Eh?'
'Why now...?'
'After hearing about Kotori's accident her mother\ncollapsed. She said she doesn't want to worry her\nparents anymore.'
'She said she's done...'
As I spoke, I could feel tears welling up in my\neyes.
I took a deep breath to pull myself together.
'Where's Amane...?'
I was planning to give Isuka's diary to her.
It wasn't something I should be holding on to.
'...She went outside just now.'
'Ah, okay. ...I'll go look for her.'
A strong wind was blowing outside.
Due to its shape, strong winds often blow on\nWindmill Hill. That wasn't the reason this time.
When the Morning Glory appears, the air stream\nbecomes turbulent, and strong winds will blow.
Looking at the sky, I still couldn't see the\ncloud formation, although it was clear it was\ncoming.
I sat down on the grass.
I had no real intention of going to look for\nAmane.
I just couldn't stay in there. I had to get out.
The wind ran noisily up the grassy plain.
This is where it all began.
I came back home after becoming unable to ride my\nbicycle. Then the first time I came to this hill,\nI met Kotori.
Her wheelchair had a flat tire, and I helped her.\nThat's how it started.
A year has passed since then.
We lived together as each other's sky gazing\npartner.
We argued, yet we always looked up at the same\nsky.
Please don't get her all wrapped up in your\nnormal person dreams...
'...He says that, not even knowing what his\ndaughter feels when she looks up at the sky...!'
'... I want to fly.'
'The Morning Glory... I want to fly right through\nit.'
'If I do... I feel like I can have my future\nback.'
'... That's right. My future. That's the biggest\nthing I lost.'
'I feel like if I fly through Morning Glory...\nI'll have it back.'
Could Kotori find happiness by going back to her\nparents' home?
Giving up on her dream... Throwing away her\nfuture...
There's no way she'd be happy.
I wish I could bring her back right now.
But that would completely disrupt Kotori's\nfamily.
This is my family's problem...
If I don't go home... My family would entirely\nfall apart. I couldn't let that happen...
Kotori had to decide which one of those things\nwas more important.
Without any trouble, she chose her family.
'...I just want her to come back.'
'Although I guess that just means I'm being\nselfish.'
I looked down at the paper airplane that I was\ngiven along with Isuka's navigation diary.
It was a completely normal paper airplane.
There was nothing special about how it was made.\nThere was nothing written anywhere.
She had given up on flying, but not the desire to\nfly. Was that the message?
I picked up the paper airplane and threw it.
It quietly glided through the night sky.
It fortunately missed a head on wind, then\nproceeded to fly towards the hill's bottom and\ndisappeared into the darkness.
'It flies well. Kotori definitely made it.'
As I was complementing the paper airplane, I saw\nsomeone coming up from the foot of the hill.
It was Amane.
'Did you throw this?'
She was holding the paper airplane in her hand.
She came over near me and stared out at the lake\nat the bottom of the hill.
'Sure is a nice breeze.'
'Yeah...'
'I found a really good place. You're going to be\nable to fly, Aoi!'
'I wonder.'
'...You seem completely unmotivated. What\nhappened?'
'...I don't know. I don't know what the right\nthing to do is.'
Without realizing it, I had begun complaining.\nAmane gave me a perplexed look.
I still hadn't told her about Kotori. Of course\nshe'd be confused.
'Sorry, I'm rambling. Forget it.'
'Right or wrong... I don't think it's either.'
'The only one who can decide is you, right? There\nare going to be some who think you're right and\nsome who think you're wrong. All sorts.'
'So you have to figure out what is right to you.\nAnd forget what everyone else says.'
'When you don't know what to do, you need to\nlisten to your heart. That's where your 'right'\nanswer is.'
'Um... Well...'
I stared blankly at the poetry coming out of\nAmane's mouth.
'That's what Isuka said to me.'
'I was surprised. Up until then I always thought\nthere was just one right answer to every problem\nI had.'
'Isn't she a genius??'
'Yeah... Seems like it.'
'So you need to listen to your heart.'
'...Me? I'm an idiot. I still can't really do\nthat all so well.'
Sounding embarrassed as she spoke, Amane handed\nthe paper airplane to me.
'Well then. I guess I'll start the flight plan\nover again.'
She stood up and headed off to the secret base.
As I watched her walk away, a light went on in my\nhead.
Suddenly, I remembered everything from that\nmoment.
The first time I met Kotori.
A white paper airplane had gently flown over my\nhead.
It was almost as if one of the windmill blades\ndetached and flew through the air.
I picked it up, climbed up the hill, and then...
I met her.
A girl in a wheelchair with a sense of innocence\nabout her.
She was staring wistfully up at the sky. As the\nwind came and blew her long hair, she rain her\nfingers through it.
A black haired girl in a white blouse sat with a\nscenery of windmills and a blew sky surrounding\nher.
It was like looking at a painting.
So, it got to you...
As she said that, tears began to well in her\neyes.
She had thrown the paper airplane.
What did she say then?
That way, someone might get my SOS and come here\nfor me...
My body trembled.
I looked at the perfectly plain paper airplane.
Could this really be an SOS...?
Was this Kotori calling out for help?
It probably wasn't.
Since I want to see her so badly, I'm probably\nconnecting the dots in my head.
However...
'If she is, I'm too late.'
I stood up and ran in the opposite direction of\nthe secret base.
I pulled out my cell phone as I ran.
'Hello... Aoi...?'
'Can I ask you to get the glider ready?'
'Huh? ...Yeah, sure. But why all of a sudden?'
'I'm going to go get Kotori.'
'Ageha?'
'Atta boy!'
'Leave everything here to me. You just make sure\nto bring her!'
As soon as I hung up, I called An-chan.
'...C'mon, An-chan. Pick up.'
Nope. He's not picking up.
I decided to hang up and make a different call.
'Hello?'
'Sorry for calling so late. This is Aoi!'
'Aoi?'
'Is she... is Kotori there?!'
I asked almost completely out of breath. Hibari\nwas deathly silent.
'Actually, my father already came for her...'
'...I thought he was coming tomorrow.'
'He said he wanted to take her back before she\nchanged her mind.'
'When was this?!'
'Just now. It hasn't been more than five\nminutes...'
'I see... Thanks.'
Before hanging up, I remembered there was\nsomething else I had to talk about.
'Can you come here now?'
'What? Me?'
'Yes.'
'I want you to see what Kotori was aiming for.\nPlease.'
Whether or not Kotori flies, I want her sister to\nsee.
I wanted her to see what Kotori, what all of us\nwere after.
'...I see.'
'I guess that didn't work.'
An-chan didn't seem to be answering.
I thought I'd ask him to use his car...
Taxis don't run at this hour in this countryside.
'...Guess there's only one thing left to do.'
Just to be safe, I left a message for An-chan.\nWhen I was ready, I put a hand on my partner that\nI'd been maintaining every day.
'Alright, buddy. Let's do this.'
'Aoi said he's going to go get Kotori!'
'Really!?'
'Yep. Let's just leave her to him. He'll\ndefinitely bring her back.'
'Hey guys.'
'Great timing. How did it go?'
'Perfect.'
'That's good...'
'All that's left is the glider.'
'I'll be taking care of that.'
'Asa, I want you to take care of the take off\npreparations. We need a lot of people, doesn't\nmatter who!'
'Oh yeah, they'll need a light too. Get a\nflashlight or something and assemble.'
'Roger!'
'This is the moment of truth! It's going to get\nbusy!!'
'*pant* *pant* ... *pant* ... *pant* ...!!'
I sprinted down the southward bound road next to\nthe lake.
'(There's no way they could have gone 100\nkilometers... No reason to preserve my leg\nstrength!)'
It was about thirty kilometers to where I had to\ngo. I couldn't go my full speed, but I was still\ngoing very fast.
If I couldn't catch Kotori there, I wouldn't be\nable to go after them anymore.
That place was 'Saza Namiobashi Bridge', located\ndirectly south of here.
The giant bridge was connected to an island in\nthe middle of the lake, making it look like some\nsort of undulating wave.
Even ignoring the beautiful landscape, due to its\nconvenience, any Tokyo bound car would definitely\ntake that route.
I calculated how much time I had left.
It wouldn't take an hour to get to the bridge\nfrom Hibari's house.
Since it was late at night, they could be\nspeeding. But I doubt Kotori's father would be\nthat dangerous.
Instead, he was very likely obeying the speed\nlimit and driving safely.
It was about thirty kilometers to the bridge from\nthe dorm. I was much closer than they were.
'(If I hurry, I can catch up with them!)'
I pedaled as hard as I could.
'*pant* *pant* ... Hey Ma-bou, sorry we're late.'
'Yeah, sorry for keeping you waiting'
'Yo! What took you so long?'
'It took us a while to get this.'
'Uwa! A blowtorch... What are you going to do\nwith that?'
'Isn't it obvious? I'm going to break the lock!'
'I'm going to break the lock!' What are you\ntalking about? Are you crazy?'
'What? It's more sophisticated than smashing the\nlock, and it'll make less noise, too.'
'...Hotaru, are you sure you want to get involved\nwith this?'
'I want to help Aoi and everybody.'
'...Okay, looks like I'm in, too.'
'Okay, let's go! We don't have much time!'
'We have to have everything ready before Aoi and\nKotori get here.'
'...Which means!'
'Everybody has to help!'
'Ooh, they're finally going to fly! What should\nwe do, Yuka?'
'We're going to help, of course! That's why we\ncame back.'
'I'll help too, Asa.'
'Thank you so much!'
'I'm so glad I messaged everybody.'
'Oh yeah, and if you could get a flashlight, or\nsome kind of light you can hold, that would be\ngreat.'
'Anything will work?'
'Yeah. Just as long as it is bright.'
'Oh, in that case we've got something we can use,\nright Yuka?'
'What? Oh yeah, that. Yeah, we do have some, if\nit'll work.'
'The summer concert was cancelled due to rain.'
'That's right! I was so bummed out. I was really\nlooking forward to it...'
'Asa, are there enough people? I could probably\nget some more to help.'
'Really?! If possible we could use about ten\nmore...'
'Gotcha. I'll go make some calls.'
'Ah, but it's the middle of the night. Is that\nalright?'
'Hmm. Maybe! If I say that the Soaring Club is\nfinally going to fly I think everybody will\ncome!'
'You think so?'
'Everyone has been waiting for this. Everyone\nexpects the club to do something amazing.'
'Mm-hm. Flying sure has a romantic feel to it.'
'Everyone is doing their best...'
'You guys...'
'Akari? Sorry, were you sleeping? Hm, you were\nup?'
'Yep, that's right. You sure are quick. Right,\nwell then so if you could...'
'The wind sure is getting strong...'
'A lot more than we predicted.'
'If the wind is too strong, the takeoff will be\nalmost impossible.'
'Hmm... That's no good.'
'...I wonder if everyone'll be able to help.'
'Don't worry. Everything'll go just fine.'
'They're all good people!'
'...It's not definite yet, but...I feel the same\nway.'
'You can sleep, Kotori.'
'Okay...'
Dad's car drove quietly through the night roads.
The destination was Tokyo. My home.
'Sorry for coming so late. I just wanted you to\nmeet your mother as soon as possible.'
'If we leave now, we'll get home by morning.'
'...It's okay. I understand. I want to see mom\ntoo.'
'I'm sure she'll be fine again as soon as you're\nhome. She'll probably want to cook for you. What\nwould you like?'
'Hmm... maybe a rice omelet.'
'Not croquettes? Didn't you use to love those?'
'I can make those myself now. ...Maybe next time\nI'll make some for mom.'
'Ooh, now that sounds like fun. You'll make some\nfor me too, right?'
'I dunno... Haha, of course I will.'
He was laughing. It seemed to be coming from the\nheart.
It wasn't forced at all. He was genuinely happy.
That made me a little happier.
Our little chitchat was over as quickly as it\nstarted.
All I heard was the awful sound of the tires\nagainst the asphalt.
I opened my cell phone to try to distract myself\nfrom the silence.
I saw a sign just now. The Morning Glory is\ncoming tomorrow morning.
I stared blankly at the message.
It was the last one I got from the person I love.
'Uwa!?'
'Aiee!'
'...That was close. People sure drive recklessly\nat night...'
'Are you okay?'
'Yeah... I'm fine.'
'Those kinds of people are why accidents will\nnever go away...'
'Can I open the window?'
'Is the AC on too high?'
'No, that's not it. I just want to feel the\nbreeze...'
After opening the window, I looked up at the sky.
It was completely black.
In that black sky, though, I knew the passage of\nclouds was slowly but surely being made.
A sign.
The Morning Glory's sign.
The sky I had been longing for all this time.
If I was in this town for just one more day, no,\njust tomorrow morning, I would be able to see it.
However, this car was taking me further and\nfurther away from Kazegaura every second.
'Where are we right now?'
'In a little bit you'll be able to see Saza\nNamiobashi Bridge. Ah, do you remember that big\nbridge we crossed before?'
'Oh yeah, that nice bridge.'
A large bridge that spanned over a lake.
That was the exit out of Kazegaura.
Soon I'd be leaving the town that I grew to love\nso much.
Could you do that? ...
Quit school, go back home, and live like that ...
A chill went down my spine as I remembered those\nwords.
That was the cruelest thing that he ever said to\nme.
It didn't matter when he said it to me.
Today, or even a year ago...
Either way, it was the cruelest thing.
'Hey, dad...'
'Yeah?'
'...Never mind.'
I'm completely different from a year ago.
I have tons of memories now.
In my heart there was an album of memories of all\nthe days I spent with everyone.
There might be no future for me there, but...
I can relive those moments just by opening that\nalbum.
So, I'll be fine.
I have to do this...
Because if I don't, Mom and Dad will...
'I really tried, dad...'
'I trained hard... I was able to pilot the\nglider.'
'Ah.'
'I flew hundreds of meters up in the sky...'
'It was so much fun...'
'You'll find something else you enjoy. Something\nsafer.'
'That's not it... That's not it at all...'
'There's nothing that compares to flying the\nglider...'
We've had the same conversation over and over.
My father just continued to drive quietly with a\nsad look on his face.
'...Look, you can see the bridge now.'
'Please, dad...'
'Kotori...'
He looked at me again with sad eyes.
'I know you're upset. But that's just for now.\nOnce you start living at home again, you'll\nforget all of this.'
I wonder.
Could I really throw away my dreams and live like\nnothing had happened?
'You'll be able to make friends back home.'
The car slowly carried me over the bridge.
Once I crossed it, there'd be no going back.
I was leaving the town that I once hated. The\ntown that I now loved.
Suddenly, I saw something in the side mirror.
Is that... Is that a bicycle?
'...Dad, stop the car!'
'Huh? What's that?'
'Please, just stop the car!'
'Don't be ridiculous! Why in the world do you\nwant to stop...'
'Dad!'
'*pant* ... *pant* *pant* ...'
'Just... a little... more...'
I was almost at the top of the hill.
Once I got there, a long downhill ride was\nwaiting for me.
The bicycle was in good condition, but my legs\nweren't.
The tailwind that was helping me move was like\nsome sort of miracle.
'Only a bit more... C'mon...!'
It took more time than I had thought.
But if I just make it up to the top...
Finally, I reached the peak of the hill.
I tried to catch my breath as I pedaled across\nthe flat hilltop.
After about ten meters or so I'll be going\ndownhill.
I could suddenly see it right before my eyes.
The wide lake and the bridge going right across\nit.
'There it is...!'
I picked up my pace.
Using energy I did not know my body still had, I\npedaled down the hill.
I stooped forward and the bicycle accelerated.
Downhill.
Tearing down through the wind was an incredible\nthrill.
I knew I'd probably die if I fell, but I wasn't\nscared.
On my way down the hill, I passed a slow moving\ncar.
This was a car that had passed me going uphill\njust a few minutes ago.
I kept pedaling.
The bicycle kept accelerating.
The bridge begins at the bottom of the hill\nand... there they are!
'KOTORI!!!'
Perfect timing
The familiar station wagon passed through an\nintersection only a mere 30 meters ahead of me.
Final sprint.
The hill ended. I pedaled across the flat land\nafter the station wagon.
'KOTORI!!'
I pushed with every ounce of my body and put my\nbicycle in front of the station wagon.
I could hear the brakes squeal as the car came to\na halt.
As soon as I saw it stop, I hit the brakes on my\nbicycle.
Then...
My bicycle fell to the ground and I went with it.
'*pant*... *pant*... *pant*... *pant*...!'
I laid upon the asphalt, trying to catch my\nbreath.
'Are you alright!?'
Kotori's father got out of the car.
I pulled my body up, struggling to stand on my\nshaking knees.
'*pant* ... *pant* *pant* ... *pant* ...'
'Huh? You...'
'*pant* *pant* ...Kotori.'
Seeing her face, a feeling of relief came over me\nthat nearly sent my knees buckling down again.
Her father came over to help me up, but I grabbed\nthe bridge handrail and lifted myself up before\nhe could.
Kotori looked at me, completely unable to believe\nwhat was right before her eyes.
'Why are you here...?'
I pulled a crumbled piece of paper, paper that\nuntil moments ago was in the shape of an\nairplane, and showed it to Kotori.
'I saw... your SOS.'
'It worked...'
Kotori's eyes began to swell with tears.
'Habane-san... Please... Please don't take Kotori\nback home.'
'...Did you follow us just to say that?'
'Please!'
'...I already told you. This is our family's\nproblem.'
'I heard about your wife. About her\ncollapsing...'
'And you still came here...!'
'Because I couldn't let this happen to Kotori!'
'You told me on the phone, remember? How Kotori\nlying to you was your own fault...'
'Kotori doesn't hate you. Even now she still\ndeeply cares about you.'
'Despite all that, she lied to you. Don't you\nunderstand now why she did that?'
I was basically pleading at this point.
'In order to fix this she has to go back to her\nfamily!'
'...Do you want her to lie to you again?'
'What!'
'This paper airplane was an SOS from Kotori.'
'This was the only way she could ask for help.\nYou have to try to understand what she wants.'
She never said that by phone or messages.
Everything Kotori was saying indicated that she\nwas going to go back home.
Except for this paper airplane.
She couldn't hide her true feelings. That would\nhave been betraying herself.
Folding this paper airplane was an SOS from\nKotori's heart.
'Kotori said that if she was able to fly through\nthe Morning Glory that she will have taken back\nher future.'
'Her future...?'
'Right. Whether or not she'll think she'll be\nable to realize her dreams or not in the future.'
'You said it yourself, didn't you? How she can't\nhave dreams that normal people have.'
'That's... That's the truth.'
'You realize this, don't you? How hard it is for\nher to do things normal people can easily do!?'
I silently nodded.
Of course I knew that. I had been beside her all\nthis time.
'Don't you see how much she suffers when she\ntries her best to reach a goal she can't?'
'She'll hurt herself, suffer... She'll do nothing\nbut ruin herself!'
The heart wrenching way in which he spoke made it\nseem as he might have seen Kotori like that time\nand time again.
...No, he had to have seen it. He had seen his\ndaughter struggle to recuperate after the\naccident.
'So what does that even mean?'
'What?'
'Kotori isn't afraid of those things at all.'
'Even after the accident, after losing the\nability to use her legs, after all that, she\nstill wants to fly. Doesn't that mean anything?'
'Sure, she's handicapped. She cries easily. She's\nscared of strange things... If you just look at\nher you'd think she's fragile, but'
'She has never turned her back on her goal! She's\nbeen courageously pressing forward this whole\ntime.'
'Aren't you just stopping her to prevent your own\nfears? Your own worries...?'
'That's not the same as loving your daughter...'
'Aoi!'
Kotori interrupted what I was saying.
I snapped back to reality and shut my mouth.
However her father already knew what I was trying\nto say.
Regardless, what I said, as honest as it may have\nbeen, was surely intensely painful for him to\nhear.
'If you are going to take Kotori back to Tokyo...\nThere is nothing I can do to stop you.'
It is a family problem.
Kotori is still only a student. She can't live\ncompletely separated from her parents.
'But before that... can't you let her fly just\nonce?'
'Let us show you that what we all have been\nworking towards hasn't been for nothing...\nplease.'
'Dad.'
Kotori began to get out of the passenger seat by\nherself.
Unable to use her legs, she was hanging onto the\ndoor as she began to fall out of the car.
'Kotori!'
He ran over and caught his daughter.
'Get the wheelchair!'
'Okay!'
I unloaded the wheelchair from the back of the\nstation wagon.
Kotori's father gently sat her into it.
Watching him do it, I could tell he was a caring\nparent.
As she was being held in her father's arms, she\nput a hand to his chest and said,
'Dad, I... I really did fly, you know...'
'I was... I was so high up I could touch the\nclouds...'
'I know.'
'It was so wonderful... Up there I felt like a\ncompletely normal girl.'
'But isn't that just because so many people\nhelped you...?'
'...Yeah.'
'Yeah, but it's not like Kotori is special.'
I decided to break the silence.
'No one can fly a glider by themselves.'

'You need someone to man the winch, someone to
hold the wing tips, someone to do maintenance,
someone to make it... so many people are needed
to make it fly.'
'Dad, please... Let me fly. I want to fly.'
'Just one last time, and then I'll go home. No\ncomplaints.'
'Kotori...'
Looking at his beloved daughter, Mr. Habane shook\nhis head.
'Dad!'
'If I don't fly now, I'll live the rest of my\nlife having lied to myself.'
'I won't be able to fly on my own wings again...'
'I don't want to live the rest of my life simply\nlooking up at the sky...'
Her father quietly closed his eyes.
Then quietly...
'Let's get it assembled now!! This is going to\nfly as soon as the pilot gets here!!!'
'Whoa, whoa.'
'The wind's strong, so be careful! Try not to let\nthe wings get hit by the wind from the front.'
'Got... Got it.'
'Everyone, be careful!!'
'It's like a festival, there are so many people\nhere.'
'You're the one that got them to come, right?'
'Well, I thought everyone would like to come\nwatch. Don't you think?'
'...Well, it is pretty interesting. I wouldn't\nwant to miss it.'
'Like I said, hehe!'
'Dinner's ready! We've got some rice balls here.\nIf you're not busy, now's your time to eat.'
'There's tuna, salmon and chicken.'
'Ooh, salmon for me. What do you want, Hotaru?'
'I'll take tuna...'
'...Here you go, guys.'
'How long until dawn?'
'Fifty-four minutes.'
'We'll be cutting it close...'
'That's if our pilot makes it here.'
'Assembly complete!'
'Is the moor set properly?'
'Yes!'
'Good. All right, everyone gather now. I'm going\nto explain the launch procedures.'
'Okay, ready? First, the people pulling the\nrubber cord are going to spilt off into two teams\n- Asa's and Yoru's.'
'When I say 'Start launch preparations!', pick up\nthe cord.'
'After that both groups are going to start taking\nsteps, one by one. They need to be in sync.'
'Then, after the glider takes off...'
'Ah!'
'Look over there!'
'Ageha!!! Aoi and Kotori are here!!!'
I unsteadily lowered myself from the back of\nAn-chan's truck.
My knees were still shaking.
That sprint had used up all of my energy. I could\nhardly use my legs.
'...I have been skipping out on practice way too\nmuch.'
'Aoi!!'
'Hey, Ageha! Could you help Kotori get down?'
'Yeah! Hey, Asa. Help me out!'
'Alright!'
An-chan had heard the message I left him and was\nable to bring Kotori and me here in his truck.
After all, Kotori's father wasn't exactly ready\nto allow this.
'Thanks from coming, An-chan.'
'Don't worry about it. I'm sorry I didn't answer\nyour call.'
'Glad to see you back, Kotori!'
'Yeah... I'm glad to be back.'
'Geez, you sure made us worry!'
'Hehehe... I'm sorry, everybody.'
After getting into her wheelchair, Kotori came\nover to me.
'Are your legs alright?'
'Yeah, they're just a little tired. But it feels\nlike I can barely move, so I'm going to have to\nask you to pilot.'
I said it half serious and half trying to be\nmotivating. It did manage to make Kotori smile.
'Y, Yeah...!'
'Kotori! You're looking good!'
'Amane!'
Kotori's mood suddenly picked up when she saw\nAmane running towards us waving.
'We've been waiting for you two, you know.'
'Sorry for keeping you waiting.'
'Sheesh. You have no idea how much you had us\nworrying.'
Behind the wry comments of Amane and Yoru were\nexpressions of relief.
'Hey... It's looking like a festival or\nsomething.'
A crowd of fifty or so people had gathered around\nour secret base.
The crowd was growing more and more excited,\nlooking somewhat like a group tour that had\ngotten lost.
'Kanako got them all to come. Everyone came to\nwatch our flight!'
'All of them?'
'Yup! We've been keeping them waiting.'
Kotori looked at everyone, dumbfounded.
'Okay, okay. No time to get all emotional! Amane,\ncould you explain the flight plan changes to\nthese two?'
'Oh yeah, that's right.'
Ageha left us with Amane and went off to instruct\nthe crowd.
She began to explain all sorts of things to them.
'Hey, don't we have to get to the runway?'
'Huh? ...Oh yeah, I forgot.'
I hadn't told Kotori about the broken winch.
'The truth is...'
'Whaaaaaaat!!!!!'
'That Tobioka! ...I'll never forgive him for\nthis.'
'...But, how can we fly then?'
'We're going to fly from here.'
'Huh?'
Amane spread her arms out wide.
'We're going to use this hill!'
'...What? How??'
Amane began explaining the takeoff procedures to\na confused looking Kotori.
'Are you serious?'
'Yup. Completely.'
Kotori gave me a worried look.
'Don't worry. If Amane says we can do it, we\ncan.'
'...You're right. Amane always knows what she's\ntalking about.'
'It's time for you two to head to the cockpit.'
'Okay.'
'Roger!'
Preparing our parachutes, we got into the\ncockpit.
We checked the operation system.
'Right aileron, OK. Left aileron, no problems.'
My preflight nerves were slowly increasing.
Suddenly,
'Kotori.'
Hibari had come running up to the cockpit.
'Hibari!? What are you doing here?'
'I asked her to come. I wanted her to see what\nyou were doing.'
'Yeah, I'm going to watch. ...So, be careful,\nokay?'
Hibari looked a little pale.
She really seemed like she wanted to stop Kotori.
Saying nothing, she let her little sister go.
Kotori laughed and gave a thumbs up.
'Just leave it to me. I'll show you what I can\ndo.'
Hibari gave a subtle smile to her little sister\nand walked away from the cockpit.
Ageha then came over to talk to us.
'Amane told me the takeoff procedures. Once the\nrubber cord has been pulled, I'll give a signal.\nRelease the break then, and it'll move.'
'Roger.'
'It's going to be a rough take off. Are you\nokay...?'
Ageha asked in an uneasy tone.
'Yep, I'll be fine. I know exactly what I need to\ndo.'
'Okay, good. I believe in you, Kotori.'
Saying that, Ageha closed the canopy.
She flashed me a look.
It seemed as if she was asking me to take care of\nKotori should anything happen.
I silently nodded in response.
As the dome came down over the cockpit, all the\noutside noises seemed to drift far away, leaving\nus in a world of our own.
Kotori put a hand to her chest and took a deep\nbreath.
She seemed nervous.
'...Thanks for coming for me.'
It was a faint whisper, but I could still hear\nher.
I replied to her in a doubtful tone.
'Honestly, I don't know if this is going to go\nokay.'
'Me neither.'
We still didn't have her father's understanding.
We were able to explain ourselves and bring her\nhere.
Kotori looked up at the sky.
Only a little bit more until dawn. The sky slowly\nbrightened and the silhouette of the giant cloud\ndimly came into view.
'...Now is our only chance.'
'You're right.'
This was the first time a Morning Glory had\nappeared in Kazegaura in 27 years.
If we miss this chance, who knows when we'll have\nanother.
'Start launch preparations! C'mon everyone, get\nready!'
As Ageha started issuing instructions, the crowd\nof people began to move.
They broke up into two groups and readied the\nrubber cord.
Ageha then tied the cord to the hooks underneath\nthe glider.
The connecting piece was located in the middle of\nthe long rubber cord.
From there they stretched the cord to the left\nand the right.
On each side, one led by Asa, the other by Yoru,\nnumbers of people lined up holding onto it.
The sides were, of course, not stretching out\ndirectly left and right of the glider.
They were slight diagonals.
This way, the people pulling on the cord would\nnot get hit by the glider.
The problem is, in order for the glider to fly\nstraight, both sides need to be at the exact same\nangle and use the exact same power.

Asa and Yoru's positioning were such that their
strides would sync. As they were twins, they had
almost the exact same physique, even down to
breathing.
Ageha tapped on the canopy.
'Ready?'
I nodded and Ageha responded with a thumbs up. I\ncould hear cries of 'Good luck!' from the crowd.
'Okay! Let's pull! ONE!!'
The rubber cord was pulled back one step.
'TWO!!'
Another step.
The cord was slowly stretching.
All the while, the glider remained firmly planted\nto the ground.
Wheel stoppers were in place and the tires were\nhooked into them.
When Kotori releases the break, the tires will\nrelease from them and begin to move.
'FIIIIIVE! SIIIIIIIIX!'
Everyone's tension seemed to be increasing just\nlike the rubber cord's.
Hibari was watching from over by the canopy with\na worried look on her face.
'...I'd really like him to see it, too.'
I think we were able to explain Kotori's feelings\nto her father.
He hadn't given his blessings, however.
It's terrifying.
The memories of his daughter falling from the hot\nair balloon must still haunt him.
'ELEEEVEN! TWEEEEELVE!'
The wind rolling up the hill became stronger and\nstronger.
It began to make the wings tremble.
The glider was shaking as if it was ready to fly\nany moment.
'Concentrate. Hold on to the control stick\ntightly.'
'...Yeah.'
'Don't think about anything other than flying\nright now.'
'...Roger.'
Then at that moment...
A single station wagon climbed to the top of the\nhill.
The car stopped in front of the secret base and a\nman in a suit climbed out of the driver's side.
'Kotori!'
'Dad!'
'SIXTEEEEN!'
Ageha stopped her counting once she saw Kotori's\nfather.
Had he come to stop the flight?
Oddly, he wasn't coming over to the cockpit.
He had stopped walking and was watching from a\ndistance.
Hibari walked over and joined him.
Ageha threw a confused look over to us.
'Takeoff preparations ready!'
'Let's go, Kotori!!'
Kotori released the break.
The cord began to pull back and the glider began\nto move!
It gained speed and ran down the hill.
'Kotori!'
'Yeah!'
Kotori pulled on the control stick.
The wings began to lift up and the glider took\nflight!
'Whoa.'
'Alright! Go, go!'
'C'mon, fly!'
It was only a few meters.
But it was just high enough.
Kotori instantly returned the control stick to\nneutral and then pushed it forward slightly.
The glider began to fly parallel to the hill,\ndeclining almost as if it was slipping.
'Air speed is good. Take off is a success.'
The glider flew parallel to the hill and began to\npick up speed like it was coasting.
It cut right through the headwind.
This was right in the middle of Windmill Hill.
A path was made from all the wind blowing into\nthe crescent shaped hill.
The strength of that head wing was enough to lift\nup the glider.
'We did it! We're flying! I can't believe that\nworked!'
'Don't get excited just yet.'
We had pointed the glider downwards in order to\npick up speed. That cost us a lot of altitude.
Now we needed to get back up.
Otherwise we'll never get to the top of the\nclouds.
'I know, I know!'
'Everybody out of the way!!! Move out of the way\nnow!!!'
'They'll be coming right back!!!!'
'If you don't have a light, go get one now!!!!'
'Habane-san! Hibari-san!'
'...What's wrong, Asa?'
'He... Here... Take this if you'd like.'
'...A glow stick?'
'Why do you have these...?'
The glider had made it down the hill safely, but\nnow was heading towards the lake.
In the predawn darkness, the lake looked like a\ncavernous darkness.
We flew right over that hole.
We were just high enough.
But our altitude wasn't right just yet.
'Kotori! Make a U-turn!'
'Roger!'
Kotori pulled the control stick sideways.
The glider began to turn.
'Watch out for height loss! Speed as well!'
'Got it!'
Being careful not to lose precious speed, Kotori\nmade a sharp turn.
However, there was still a loss.
'Are we going fast enough...?'
'Thanks to the glide effect we won't descend that\nmuch... I think.'
But we're above a lake.
In the off chance we do crash, it won't be\npretty.
Our speed hadn't decreased that much, however now\nwe had a different tailwind. As our speed\ndecreases, so does our ability to rise.
'How's our target?'
'... Can't see it yet.'
Windmill Hill, which was where we launched from,\nwas now nothing but a silhouette.
We could barely make out the ridge line through\nthe light of the sky that was peeking through,\nbut telling the distance was nearly impossible.
Even worse, up, down, left, right, front, back -\neverywhere was pitch black. We had no sense of\ndirection.
'Don't get confused by how it looks. Pay\nattention to the instruments.'
'Got it!'
When the range of sight is limited by thick fog\nor clouds, flying by the instruments is the only\noption.
If you rely on poor vision, illusions will cause\na loss of feel for your true positioning.
However, since Kotori doesn't have much flight\nexperience, she still isn't used to looking at\nthe instruments.
I supported Kotori as we waited for our target to\nappear.
At that moment -
'Ah! Look over there, Aoi!'
A small light twinkled within the darkness. As we\nmoved on we saw a line of lights going up the\nhill.
'It's Yuka and everybody!'
Everyone who had gathered was holding a light,\nmaking a pathway for us.
This was another part of Amane's flight plan.
Creating this trail of light was another reason\nfor all the people with lights were assembled.
Once the target was determined, Kotori would be\nable to fly there without the risk of making a\nmistake.
The glider was making its way back to Windmill\nHill where it launched off from.
'We're nearing the hill. Raise the pitch!'
'Roger!'
Kotori pulled on the control stick.
As she did, the glider felt as if it was being\nraised from below.
'Looks like we did it!'
The glider began to ride the lift.
We began to rise higher and higher, fueled by the\nstrong wind.
This lift was different from a vertical draft.
This wind, a slope drift, was a strong upward\nsloping wind coming from between the hill and the\nmountains
This was the wind that went up the face off the\nhill. The wind that powered the windmills. The\nwind that we felt as we walked on the hill.
The glider continued to accelerate and rise\nhigher.
We went past the many small lights that were down\nbelow us.
We couldn't make them out individually, but those\nwere all lights held, one by one, for us.
'The light is moving. They're waving their arms\nfor us...'
'Watch out. You're going to run into the\nwindmill.'
If we followed the trail of lights, we wouldn't\nhit the windmill. However who knows what would\nhappen if there was a mistake.
'Okay.'
Riding on the slope lift, the glider slipped past\nthe group of windmills.
Then, in the blink of an eye, we flew over the\nhill. We began to rise higher and higher, headed\ntowards the dimly breaking dawn.
'Woah... Seeing it up close is unbelievable.'
'I can't believe it went that fast...'
'Wow, wow, wow... They are just so unbelievably\nawesome right now.'
'Aoi is always awesome.'
'Hey Ageha, are we done with the lights?'
'Ah, yeah. Thanks, Hotaru.'
'Thanks for all your help, everyone!! The glider\ntook off safely!!'
'Thanks for the glow sticks. They were really\nhelpful!'
'I'm just glad it helped!'
'But why do you have so much?'
'Yuka has been going around seeing all the\nconcerts of a certain idol group.'
'They're concert supplies! I need about twenty or\nso for each concert, so I always keep a supply!'
'Aha... I see.'
'... Is that what Kotori is flying?'
'Seems like it...'
'Habane-san. Hibari-san. I just want to thank you\nfor helping us.'
'Oh no. We really didn't do anything...'
'Yeah...'
'There are some rice balls over there. Go ahead\nand help yourselves.'
'Um... Miss?'
'All these people... All these people came to\nhelp Kotori?'
'Yes.'
'... Just so she could fly?'
'Well, I don't know about that.'
'I don't think it was really for Kotori. They\nprobably wanted to do it themselves.'
'Our school has a lot of curious people, haha.'
'At least, that's how it is for me. I just wanted\nto see Kotori fly.'
'Really...'
'You said it yourself, 'What does flying in the\nsky even mean?''
'Well, look at the two of them up there. Doesn't\nthat make you feel anything?'
'Well, I mean, that's...'
'...I can feel it.'
'Hehehe.'
'Just you wait. Soon, you're going to see\nsomething even more amazing.'
After flying off high from Windmill Hill, we were\nable to see our next goal, Mount Tsukubae,\nlooming over the school in the distance.
'At this altitude, we should be able to make it.\nBe careful of crosswinds, since the current is\nrough.'
'Kotori?'
'Huh? Oh yeah, roger.'
'What's wrong? Are you tired?'
'No, no. I was just wondering if my father was\ndown in that light as well...'
'Ah... Yeah, I wonder too.'
'But, I think he's there. I mean, he was there\nfor takeoff.'
'This is why he came, right?'
'... That would be nice.'
'Hey, the nose is descending. Be careful.'
'Want to show me what you can do?'
'Sure.'
'I've grown a lot this past year. Let me show\nyou.'
Mt. Tsukubae was coming closer and closer.
This was the moment of truth of our flight plan.
Our next goal is to ride a giant current known as\na mountain wave. If we can do that, getting to\nthe top of the clouds should be no problem.
The problem was, how do we ride the mountain\nwave?
A mountain wave is a wave of air that is created\nby wind going over a mountain.
They are located fairly high, and have a\nrotor-like turbulence below them.
By entering the upper part of the turbulence, it\nshould be possible to get to the mountain wave.
Turbulence is incredibly unstable, however. It's\na difficult maneuver.
'Looks like we're going into this unrehearsed.'
Realizing what I had said, Kotori braced herself.
Originally we had planned to practice this.
...If only that accident hadn't happened.
'Look, Aoi...'
The eastern sky was becoming brighter and\nbrighter.
It would soon be dawn.
'Let's hurry.'
'Okay!'
'Aha! I've got you!'
'What, what? Whoa, if you're here that means...'
'What do you think you are doing here!'
'Well, uh, you see, the thing about that is\nuh...'
'The Soaring Club had been suspended!'
'Uh, well, yeah about that... Uh, what are we\ngoing to do...'
'What? What? What's wrong?'
'... Tobioka-sensei!'
'Akari...! You... You're the student council\npresident! Why didn't you stop this?'
'They're just a normal club. There's no reason to\nstop anything.'
'Ridiculous... Their club was ordered to be\ndisbanded!'
'That's the first I've heard of this.'
'On top of that, and do pardon me for saying\nthis, but I don't believe that you have the\nauthority to do anything like that.'
'Even then, there is nothing that the Student\nCouncil can do either.'
'What about how they destroyed the gym lock?'
'? That's the first I heard of that. What proof\ndo you have...?'
'You want proof? That glider is...'
'Glider? Where is the glider?'
'*looking around* '... I don't see anything like\nthat around here?'
'I'm sure I'll find something when I look. You'd\nbest prepare yourself for the consequences.'
'... You're one to talk, considering that you\nbroke the winch.'
'I'm sure if we looked into that, we'd see who\nthe real culprit was.'
'We're ready to take any punishment you hand out.\nJust today, let us be.'
'That is impossible!'
'I strongly disagree. Furthermore, you have no\nproof whatsoever.'
'Well then, what are you doing here!?'
'Everybody's come to sky watch! Soon we're going\nto be able to see a really neat cloud!'
'Would you like to come watch with us, Sensei?'
'Don't go making too much of a ruckus. Okay?!'
'Wow, you managed to get rid of him!'
'Thanks, Akari!'
'Wow, you were amazing there!'
'... Hmm. I became a tad angry.'
'That's fine though. If you let stress build up,\nit's like poison to the body.'
'Anyway, where are those two?'
'... If everything goes according to plan, they\nshould just be about to ride the wave lift.'
'Looks like we did it...!'
'Yeah... It does.'
Suddenly, just as the trembling stopped, the\nglider began to rise with almost no recoil at\nall.
It felt as if gravity had disappeared.
'So this is a wave lift...'
As we rode the rotor wind up higher and higher,\nwe reached a part of the sky that seemed like it\nhad a mountain wave.
There was a sudden change from the rough\nturbulence to a stillness.
It was peaceful, but the altimeter kept on\nrising.
We rose higher into the sky, almost as if we were\nno longer flying by wind.
'... I don't really feel any shaking at all.'
'Yeah, it's frighteningly still...'
A mountain lift is a strong wind that goes over\nmountains and is caused by the up and down\nrippling of winds.
It stretches to a few times the size of the\nmountain itself.
The world record for the highest flying glider,\nwhich made it to the stratosphere, used a\nmountain lift.
Mount Tsukubae isn't a particularly large\nmountain, but, if we can get to an altitude of\n2000 meters, it will be enough.
However, there is no guarantee that there will be\na mountain wave. The condition is entirely\ndependent on the wind that is blowing.
Today, though, I was confident that it would\nappear.
It was related to the way Amane derived that\nMorning Glory would appear in Kazegaura.
Mountain waves are known to appear along with\nstrange cloud formations.
Her hypothesis is that Morning Glory is created\nby the mountain waves from Mount Tsukubae.
Which basically means, when Morning Glory\nappears, there's no chance that there wouldn't be\nmountain waves.
The pre-dawn sky, while still dark, was beginning\nto show some strange colors as the light came\nthrough.
Before we knew it, we reached our target\naltitude.
'Look at that.'
Below us we could see the silhouette of the cloud\npassage.
We spent a moment staring in amazement at its\nmassive size.
This wasn't the 'mistake' that we saw a year ago.\nThis was the real thing.
That moment -
Rays of light began to come from the east.
'It's dawn.'
The morning sun broke through the darkness and\nbegan to light up the sky.
The light began to color the view.
The giant cloud began to sparkle.
'It's beautiful...'
Kotori whispered with a sense of amazement.
'Yeah...'
I didn't know what else to say.
I could feel tears beginning to form in my eyes.
It wasn't a feeling of joy or sorrow or even fun.
A more fundamental feeling began to fill my\nheart, and my tears began to overflow.
I was overwhelmed and, for a moment, at a\ncomplete loss for words.
'Let's go, Aoi.'
'Okay.'
Kotori pulled down on the control stick, leaving\nthe wave lift and aiming us at the passage of\nclouds.
'Whoa... Look, Yoru...'
'... I can see, Asa.'
'It's amazing... So beautiful...'
'It's just... 'divine'...'
'That's what Amane had always been chasing after.\nThat mysterious sky.'
'Seems like it... Now I understand why she'd be\nchasing after it.'
'Whoaaaaaa!! What is that!! That's so amazing!!'
'I wonder if they already flew through it...'
'That's what Isuka wanted to fly through...'
'Yeah...'
'Aoi and Kotori were able to make her dream a\nreality. They did what I couldn't.'
'We sure did a lot of good!'
'Hehe... Yeah.'
'It's so beautiful...'
'It is... But, what are those clouds...'
'It's like I'm seeing some sort of miracle.'
'It's Morning Glory.'
'Morning Glory...'
'It's a cloud formation that appears above\nKazegaura only every few decades. This is the\nfirst time I've actually seen the real thing.'
'Kotori... She flew the glider because she wanted\nto see those clouds up close?'
'See them up close? No, not that.'
'She wanted to fly above them.'
'In order to fly through those clouds you have to\nget up really high.'
'Go... above?'
'Yup!'
'Unbelievable...'
'Yeah...'
'They should probably have landed by now.'
'Right there, Kotori...'
The glider had gone through that passage of\nclouds.
It sparkled in an array of colors from the\ngradients of light that the dawn was bringing.
It was completely surreal.
For a moment, almost as if we had forgotten how\nto speak, we did nothing but let out sighs of\nadmiration.
'We finally did it.'
'Yeah, we did...'
I thought I would be happier.
However, being here, that was not what I felt.
Overwhelmed by it majesty, I felt nothing but\ngratitude towards this miracle.
The glider held its altitude and passed through\nthe clouds.
This path of clouds is created by rolling air\ncurrents.
Thanks to these rolling currents, even an\nunpowered glider can maintain flight in it for\nlong periods of time.
Kotori flipped the radio on.
'... Ageha, can you hear me?'
'Kotori? Yeah, I can. The signal seems a little\nbad, though.'
'How are you? Where are you now?'
'I flew. I flew through Morning Glory.'
'... We're passing over it right now.'
'Great! Guys, Kotori and Aoi are flying over it\nright now!'
Through the radio we can hear everyone's cheers.
'How did it feel?'
'... I don't know what to say.'
'It's like being part of a miracle.'
'Aoi? What about you?'
'It feels like I've died and gone to heaven.'
'Hey, hey. Don't go saying things like that.'
'Really, though. That's what it feels like. I\ncan't believe this is really happening.'
'Yeah...'
'Looking from down here is amazing. I can't even\nimagine how great it looks like up there.'
'Enjoy your time up there.'
'Thanks. Thanks so much, everyone.'
'We're waiting to hear all about it. Ageha over\nand out.'
As soon as the radio was turned off the cockpit\nwent silent.
At that moment -
'Whoa...'
The sun began peaking above the horizon, its rays\nlighting up the sky.
As it rose, the top of the clouds began to have a\ngolden glow.
'Oh my..'
'... I never imagined it would be so beautiful\nhere.'
'This is the definition of unimaginable.'
'... No one could imagine this. This view is\noutstanding.'
'Hey, Aoi.'
'Hm?'
'... Thanks for bringing me here.'
'Being able to come here is going to be the best\nmoment of my life.'
'Don't be ridiculous. You made it here yourself.'
'I guess...'
'But I wouldn't have if it weren't for you. You\nand the others...'
'Did you find it?'
'What you had lost.'
'... I think so.'
'Then that's good.'
'Hehe... My life is no longer a waste now.'
Our glider continued to fly on and on through\nthat dream-like scenery.
On and on until the morning sun dissolved the\nillusion...
